text: <https://brennan.io/2021/02/09/so-python/|https://brennan.io/2021/02/09/so-python/> so that's the trick to get more questions: add confusing features to the language :troll:

attachments.title: Stack Overflow Users Rejoice as Pattern Matching is Added to Python 3.10 - Stephen Brennan
attachments.text: Our on-the-ground reporter gauges developer reactions to the Python Steering Council's latest decision regarding pattern matching.
attachments.fallback: Stephen Brennan's Blog: Stack Overflow Users Rejoice as Pattern Matching is Added to Python 3.10 - Stephen Brennan

elements.text: so that's the trick to get more questions: add confusing features to the language

text: The "mutable default argument" thing mentioned in there is horrible

elements.text: The "mutable default argument" thing mentioned in there is horrible

text: So is that hidden assignment in the match statement. Dear God. I guess it comes from lack of scoping, internally the statement has to assign some variables, it just then leaks into the outer scope.
